Container.Name: ryansend
Container.Overview:
ryansend lets you share files on your computer via public download URLs with cryptographic tokens that automatically expire. Perfect for sharing large files directly from your home server without needing special software, accounts, or VPNs.
Features: • Share large files (tested with over 70GB) • Generates secure URLs with automatic expiration (1 hour default) • Optional admin web interface for browsing and sharing • No database required - tokens contain encrypted file paths • Extremely lightweight (~32MB Docker image, 8MB RAM idle) • Works without JavaScript for fast page loads • No external tracking or requests (except optional ko-fi link)
The admin panel (if enabled) will be available at http://[IP]:[PORT:3001]/admin/login with a randomly generated password shown in the container logs.

Config.Name: Main Port
Config.Description: Main ryansend port for file sharing URLs

Config.Name: Admin Panel Port
Config.Description: Admin panel port (only needed if admin panel is enabled)

Config.Name: AppData
Config.Description: Container config directory where config.yaml is stored

Config.Name: Shared Files
Config.Description: Directory containing files you want to share (mounted read-only for security)

Config.Name: Base URL
Config.Description: Base URL for generated sharing links. Change 'tower.local' to your server's IP or domain name. Include the port if not using 80/443.

Config.Name: Enable Admin Panel
Config.Description: Enable the web admin interface for browsing and sharing files

Config.Name: Admin Sharing Root
Config.Description: Root directory that the admin panel can browse and share from

Config.Name: Remove Ko-fi Link
Config.Description: Set to 'true' to remove the ko-fi support link from the admin panel

Config.Name: Log Level
Config.Description: Logging level (error, warn, info, debug, trace)

Config.Name: PUID
Config.Description: User ID that the container will run as

Config.Name: PGID
Config.Description: Group ID that the container will run as
